snippet: President Obama is considering a targeted, highly selective campaign of airstrikes against Sunni militants in Iraq, similar to counterterrorism operations in Yemen, rather than an aerial bombardment.
abstract: Pres Obama is considering targeted, highly selective campaign of airstrikes against Sunni militants in Iraq similar to counterterrorism operations in Yemen, rather than widespread bombardment of an air war; such a campaign, most likely using drones, could last for a prolonged period.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: President Obama is considering a targeted, highly selective campaign of airstrikes against Sunni militants in Iraq, similar to counterterrorism operations in Yemen, rather than an aerial bombardment.

headline.main: Obama Is Said to Consider Selective Airstrikes on Sunni Militants
headline.print_headline: Obama Is Said to Consider Selective Airstrikes on Sunni Militants

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
